definition: to storm off in a huff (idiom)
old variant of 弼[bi4]
to brush away
sleeve/to tuck inside one's sleeve
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Go out and audition another boss.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拂袖而去，再面試下一位老闆。

sentences.english: Mary flounced out of the room without a word.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗一言未發，拂袖而去。

sentences.english: Several times early toward always making Xiao Feng the Ming quit in peevish anger, their practical ability rests.
sentences.chinese: 幾次早朝都令蕭鳳溟拂袖而去，他們才幹休。

sentences.english: I took one look at the room and left.
sentences.chinese: 我看了一下房間就拂袖而去了。

sentences.english: That doesn't mean we turn our backs and walk away.
sentences.chinese: 但是這並不意味着我們拂袖而去。

sentences.english: The girl starts to get pissed off.
sentences.chinese: 女孩開始厭煩了，每次都是很憤怒的拂袖而去。

sentences.english: He flung out of the room white with anger and desperation .
sentences.chinese: 他拂袖而去，由於憤怒和絕望而面無人色。

definition: to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
to swing one's sleeve (in anger)
(literary) angry/irate
to get angry/to fume
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
furious/enraged
in a pique/sulky/cross
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
enraged/furious/livid
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to pant/to gasp for breath
